title: Gilani reaffirms commitment to protecting journalists, press freedom
content:
ISLAMABAD, Nov 02 (APP): Chairman Senate, Syed Yousaf Raza Gilani, has reaffirmed the Upper House’s unwavering commitment to safeguarding freedom of the press, protecting journalists, and ensuring accountability for crimes committed against media professionals.

In his message on the occasion of the International Day to End Impunity for Crimes against Journalists, the Chairman emphasized that journalists play a vital role in strengthening democracy by promoting transparency, accountability, and public awareness.

He noted that the courage and dedication of journalists in their pursuit of truth often come at great personal risk, adding that their safety must remain a collective responsibility of both the state and society.

Expressing deep concern over the rising incidents of harassment, intimidation, and violence faced by journalists across the globe, Gilani stressed that impunity for such crimes undermines justice, weakens democratic institutions, and silences free expression.

“The Senate of Pakistan strongly condemns all forms of violence and pressure tactics against journalists,” the Chairman said.

He added, “There can be no tolerance for impunity in crimes targeting media professionals. A free, responsible, and secure media is essential for the preservation of democracy and the rule of law.”

Reiterating Pakistan’s commitment to international principles of human rights and press freedom, the Chairman called upon all relevant institutions, civil society organizations, and the international community to work collectively to create an environment where journalists can perform their duties without fear or reprisal.
